Text: RE PSA DocNonPrivilegedpst Gerald The contact information for Assumption Parish is as follows Assumption Parish Police Jury Attn Kim Torres PO Box Napoleonville LA I have two changes that you may have already taken note of The first change is in the description of the property on the first page In the th line in the description it says the South property line a distance or it should read distance of This change also needs to be made in the description contained within Exhibit B In the description contained within Exhibit B there should not be a period after the words to the point of beginning in the th line The second change is also in Exhibit B on page In the paragraph that starts all parties signing the written instrument I dont think marital status should be in there One final thing the purchase price for the warehouse and land is Give me a call if you have any questions Also let me know if you need any help with the lawnmowing agreement Thanks for your help Rakhi x Original Message From Nemec Gerald Sent Friday August PM To Israni Rakhi Subject PSA Doc File Napoleonville PSAdoc

RE Sale of Assumption parish property Our File ENRNonPrivilegedpst Thanks Gerald Any progress on the lawn mowing agreement Rakhi Original Message From Nemec Gerald Sent Monday August AM To Cc Israni Rakhi Subject RE Sale of Assumption parish property Our File ENR Keith Attached is the revised PSA for the Napoleonville warehouse I removed the mineral rights reservations and added in the sales price Please review The agreement needs to be forwarded for review by the Assumption Police Jury as follows Attn Kim Torres Assumption Parish Police Jury PO Box Napoleonville LA Let me know if you have any questions File Napoleonville PSAdoc

Sorrento agreementGerald Page of the Sorrento ROW agmt has only one line on it Exhibit B of LRCI Grant of Servitude of Right of Use for Pipeline Agreement Should that be in there or can we delete that page Rakhi x
BridgelineCrawfish ROW agreementGerald Attached is a draft of the agreement for the ROWs requested by Bridgeline Would you please look it over and make any necessary changes Thanks Rakhi x

RE Sale of Napoleonville LA property Our file ENRGerald Do you know the status of the Assumption Parish documents Are we ready for Enron to execute Rakhi x Original Message From P Keith Daigle ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESPEKeithDaigleCpkdaigleneosoftEcomE NRONcom Sent Wednesday October PM To Nemec Gerald Cc Israni Rakhi Subject Re Sale of Napoleonville LA property Our file ENR Gerald I have already completed On they just want some assurance that the property has never had underground storage tanks or other hazardous waste sources on it I believe a letter from LRCI stating that to its knowledge there have been no such sources on or under the Property would suffice As far as my abstractor has promised to complete this limited title search today I hope to hear from him tommorrow PKD Nemec Gerald wrote Keith Please revise the document to reflect Item below With respect to Item our environmental group is reviewing Enrons use of the property No such uses should be found What specifically are they looking for with respect to this item Finally any word on the title check with respect to item Original Message From P Keith Daigle ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESPEKeithDaigleCpkdaigleneosoft EcomE NRONcom Sent Wednesday August PM To Nemec Gerald Subject Sale of Napoleonville LA property Our file ENR Gerald I have been contacted by Kim Torres of the Assumption Parish Police Jury She has some questions and concerns about the Purchase Sale Agreement to wit They want to add warranty language to as follows Seller warrants that it is the record title owner to the property being sold and warrants it has good and merchantable title free of any and all liens or encumbrances and agrees to indemnify and hold harmless buyer for the same Seller warrants that it is a corporation in good standing and that persons executing this sale on behalf of seller has valid and binding authority to do so I believe this additional language is acceptable with some minor revisions which I will do They are concerned about the warranty language which covers hazardous wastes in They tell me that they have not done an environmental inspection of the property They want to know if there have ever been any underground tanks or other hazardous waste sources on the property They are looking for something in writing that no such sources existed Upon checking the conveyance records they found that on March Louisiana Resources Pipeline Co LP sold the property to Louisiana Resources Co Inc Then on February Louisiana Resources Pipeline Co LP again sold the property to LRCI Inc I have not done a title exam so I cannot explain this discrepancy She gave me the physical address of the property and the name of the Police Jury President which I will insert in the documents Please contact me to discuss our response to these concerns Keith This email is the property of Enron Corp andor its relevant affiliate and may contain confidential and privileged material for the sole use of the intended recipient s Any review use distribution or disclosure by others is strictly prohibited If you are not the intended recipient or authorized to receive for the recipient please contact the sender or reply to Enron Corp at and delete all copies of the message This email and any attachments hereto are not intended to be an offer or an acceptance and do not create or evidence a binding and enforceable contract between Enron Corp or any of its affiliates and the intended recipient or any other party and may not be relied on by anyone as the basis of a contract by estoppel or otherwise Thank you

RE Sale of Napoleonville LA property Our file ENRGerald Did you hear anything from Keith Daigle regarding the title search In his last email he indicated that it would be completed last Wednesday Has Kyle Purvis gotten back to you regarding the hazardous waste sources issue Hopefully we can finalize these documents soon The guys from Assumption Parish are very anxious to get this deal closed quickly FYIregarding the Sorrento ROWs with Enterprise Products the money should be transferred this morning and the documents fully executed by this afternoon Talk to you soon Rakhi Original Message From Nemec Gerald Sent Tuesday October AM To Cc Israni Rakhi Subject RE Sale of Napoleonville LA property Our file ENR Keith Please revise the document to reflect Item below With respect to Item our environmental group is reviewing Enrons use of the property No such uses should be found What specifically are they looking for with respect to this item Finally any word on the title check with respect to item Original Message From P Keith Daigle ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESPEKeithDaigleCpkdaigleneosoftEcomE NRONcom Sent Wednesday August PM To Nemec Gerald Subject Sale of Napoleonville LA property Our file ENR Gerald I have been contacted by Kim Torres of the Assumption Parish Police Jury She has some questions and concerns about the Purchase Sale Agreement to wit They want to add warranty language to as follows Seller warrants that it is the record title owner to the property being sold and warrants it has good and merchantable title free of any and all liens or encumbrances and agrees to indemnify and hold harmless buyer for the same Seller warrants that it is a corporation in good standing and that persons executing this sale on behalf of seller has valid and binding authority to do so I believe this additional language is acceptable with some minor revisions which I will do They are concerned about the warranty language which covers hazardous wastes in They tell me that they have not done an environmental inspection of the property They want to know if there have ever been any underground tanks or other hazardous waste sources on the property They are looking for something in writing that no such sources existed Upon checking the conveyance records they found that on March Louisiana Resources Pipeline Co LP sold the property to Louisiana Resources Co Inc Then on February Louisiana Resources Pipeline Co LP again sold the property to LRCI Inc I have not done a title exam so I cannot explain this discrepancy She gave me the physical address of the property and the name of the Police Jury President which I will insert in the documents Please contact me to discuss our response to these concerns Keith

ROW agreementGerald Have you gotten a chance to look over the ROW document It seems to be a pretty standard agreement If possible we would like to get this finalized soon Once we hit the middle of Dec it will probably be harder to get anything done Let me know if you have any questions on the agreement Thanks Rakhi x

ROW and Purchase Sale Agreement Cc Joel I have attached both the agreement for the ROWs and for the purchase of the acres of the Crawfish land that Bridgeline is acquiring Please review and comment as necessary In the meantime I know that you have been working with Roger to finalize the actual ROWs that Bridgeline is requesting We can modify the ROW agreement accordingly once that has been finalized Thanks for your help Rakhi

Cameron Parish Cc Gerald I just spoke with Tina Horn from the Cameron Parish They received the letter voiding the original agreement She said that since using it for potable water was the only use they had in mind they wont be needing the ROA to the pipeline Actually she told me that their engineer had told them that it would be possible to clean the pipeline to the point that it could be used for potable water In light of this could you please look into the procedures for abandoning the pipeline according to Louisiana law Thanks for your help Rakhi x

RE Sale of Napoleonville LA property Our file ENRNonPrivilegedpst Gerald Sorry for not getting back to you sooner on this I have sent an email to David Owen about the hazardous waste question I will let you know what he says However correct me if Im wrong but I dont think we want to make any warranties about potential hazardous waste sources on the property At the most we could make a warranty about the fact if true that we have never used the property in such a manner David Owen should be able to tell us a little more about the uses of the property As far as Item below is concerned do you know if we have done a title search on the property If we need to do a title search there is a guy in Louisiana that can do it for us If we know there is a discrepancy in the chain of title is there a way to nullify the latest transfer between LRPC to LRCI Let me know what you think If you think it is necessary to meet to discuss these points please let me know Thanks Rakhi x Original Message From Nemec Gerald Sent Wednesday August PM To Israni Rakhi Subject FW Sale of Napoleonville LA property Our file ENR Original Message From P Keith Daigle ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESPEKeithDaigleCpkdaigleneosoftEcomE NRONcom Sent Wednesday August PM To Nemec Gerald Subject Sale of Napoleonville LA property Our file ENR Gerald I have been contacted by Kim Torres of the Assumption Parish Police Jury She has some questions and concerns about the Purchase Sale Agreement to wit They want to add warranty language to as follows Seller warrants that it is the record title owner to the property being sold and warrants it has good and merchantable title free of any and all liens or encumbrances and agrees to indemnify and hold harmless buyer for the same Seller warrants that it is a corporation in good standing and that persons executing this sale on behalf of seller has valid and binding authority to do so I believe this additional language is acceptable with some minor revisions which I will do They are concerned about the warranty language which covers hazardous wastes in They tell me that they have not done an environmental inspection of the property They want to know if there have ever been any underground tanks or other hazardous waste sources on the property They are looking for something in writing that no such sources existed Upon checking the conveyance records they found that on March Louisiana Resources Pipeline Co LP sold the property to Louisiana Resources Co Inc Then on February Louisiana Resources Pipeline Co LP again sold the property to LRCI Inc I have not done a title exam so I cannot explain this discrepancy She gave me the physical address of the property and the name of the Police Jury President which I will insert in the documents Please contact me to discuss our response to these concerns Keith

Title Search contactNonPrivilegedpst Gerald The name of the guy in Lafayette LA who can do a title search for us if we need him to is Art LeBlanc However you would like to handle it is fine with me Like I mentioned on the phone Roger Westbrook is the one helping with the ROWs that Bridgeline is requesting on the Crawfish land He indicated some time back that he had received some of the drawings from Bridgeline If needed I can set up a meeting with Roger once we know the status of the documents Let me know if there is anything I can do to help on either of these Thanks Rakhi
Letter to Cameron Parish Cc NonPrivilegedpst Gerald Here is the letter I drafted for Cameron Parish Please let me know what changes you would recommend Thanks for your help Rakhi x letter to cameron

assumption parish mowing letterNonPrivilegedpst Gerald fyii just received the executed original of the lawn mowing agreement I am forwarding it to your office Give me a call if you have any questions Rakhi x

FW Special Assets Environmental MattersNonPrivilegedpst Gerald There is a meeting scheduled for Tuesday Sept at am to discuss among other things the hazardous waste issues at Assumption Parish with Kyle Purvis and David Owen Would you be able to make to the meeting for about minutes to discuss this issue Any changes on the chain of title issue for the Assumption Parish deal Rakhi x Original Message From Owen David Sent Monday September PM To Morris Brandi Israni Rakhi Purvis Kyle Subject Special Assets Environmental Matters Meeting details Tuesday September EB

FW Bridgeline Crawfish Fee PropertyNonPrivilegedpst Gerald Would you know what the status of the BridgelineCrawfish documents Rakhi x Original Message From Van Hooser Steve Sent Monday August AM To Nemec Gerald Cc Johnson Patrick Subject FW Bridgeline Crawfish Fee Property Would you please coordinate with Patrick Johnson and Roger Westbrook on the conveyance of certain small tracks of Crawfish property to Bridgeline I have a few files that might help but the following outlines best what is needes More AEW undone work Steve Original Message From Johnson Patrick Sent Tuesday August PM To Van Hooser Steve Subject FW Bridgeline Crawfish Fee Property Steve we may not need to have that meeting between ourselves and Bridgeline regarding the RW easements etc on Crawfish property at least not this week Roger Westbrook has been communicating directly with the Bridgeline RW guy and they have determined that they require the following items I appreciate your help or Daigles in putting these together for execution Please communicate directly with Roger to acquire the appropriate descriptions While we have Bridgelines attention on this lets try not to lose momentum Thanks for any pressure you can put on Daigle to get this done Pat x Original Message From Westbrook Roger Sent Monday August PM To Johnson Patrick Subject Bridgeline Crawfish Fee Property Pat please note the changes I have made in red to the email copy below To Johnson Patrick Cc Denise Boihem Email Joel A Milliet Email Subject Crawfish Agreements As far I know BHLP needs the following documents from Enron for the facilities at Crawfish Surface Easement for roughly acre OR Special Warranty Deed for Sale of roughly acres Surface Easement near River Road for existing facilities Parcel VI on SurveyEquilon shared site Road IngressEgress limestone road shown on Exhibit G Need Easement ROW easements for A Pipeline going northeast from the surface facilities to the river B Pipeline going northwest from the surface facilities to Taft depends on land owned by Enron Not on Exhibit G C Pipeline coming from the southwest going to the surface facilities depends on land owned by Enron D Dual Pipelines going northeast from Parcel VI across the Mississippi River pipeline will be abandoned See detail on Exhibit G Bridgeline to determine if abandon in place or remove Abandon and pipelines See exhibit G Parcels III and IV on Exhibit G will be abandoned Bridgeline to furnish individual certified plats for each item through above Ive asked Engineering to confirm the footprint needed for the new tanks then have it surveyed For the price that was mentioned I prefer to buy the land but we need to finalize the details That needs to be resolved before I can build the new tanks we can finalize the ROW documents Once you have reviewed this please call me Im sure that both of us would like to move forward Thanks Roger Westbrook Enron Transportation Services Right of Way Dept voice fax

Meeting with Roger WestbrookNonPrivilegedpst Gerald Just to let you know I scheduled a meeting with Roger Westbrook on this Thursday Sept at pm If its okay with you we can just meet in your office at that time The two main issues to discuss are the plat and legal description for Sorrento and the BridgelineCrawfish agreement Please let me know if this doesnt work for you Talk to you soon Rakhi x
Sorrento AgmtNonPrivilegedpst Gerald Can you tell me which Enron entity is involved in the Sorrento RW Agmt This is for wiring purposes Rakhi x

Crawfish land to BridgelineGerald Would it be possible to get a draft of the agreement for the sale of the acres to Bridgeline in the next day or two This is something that we would like to finalize in the next week if possible Let me know Rakhi x

RE Sale of Napoleonville LA property our file ENRGerald There were two changes to be made to the legal description of the property contained on the first page of the agreement as well as in Exhibit B In the third line it should read a distance of not In the fourth line the degree symbol is left off the N I will send you through interoffice mail a copy of the survey plat for the land Will you or Keith take care of forwarding a copy of the agreement to the police jury for review Rakhi x Original Message From Nemec Gerald SentThursday October PM ToIsrani Rakhi CcPurvis Kyle SubjectFW Sale of Napoleonville LA property our file ENR Please review Note that on the attached letter we will remove the rep c oncernig the presence of hazardous materials According the Kyle there may have been such material stored in the warehouse Kyle Please review the letter and let me know if you see any problems Original Message From P Keith Daigle ENRON SentSaturday October PM ToNemec Gerald SubjectSale of Napoleonville LA property our file ENR Gerald I am attaching the following documents for your review Purchase and Sale Agreement Draft of the body of a letter from LRCI to the Police Jury I have revised the Purchase and Sale Agreement to add the language to the suggested by Kim Torres in and to add Louisiana Resources Inc and Louisiana Resources LP as intervenors in the Cash Sale to quitclaim the property to the Police Jury to solve the title problem Please contact me upon receipt to discuss and to fill in the blanks Keith PURCHASE AND SALE AGREEMENT This Purchase and Sale Agreement together with all Exhibits hereto and made a part hereof this Agreement is entered into effective the day of the Effective Date by Louisiana Resources Pipeline Co Inc a corporation having its principal p lace of business at appearing herein th rough its duly appointed attorneyinfact whose power of attorney has not b een revoked or rescinded as Seller and The Police Jury for the Parish o f Assumption Louisiana acting through its duly authorized President Mart in S Triche pursuant to Resolution No of the Assumption Parish Police Jury dated as Buyer each a Party and togethe r the Parties Whereas Seller is the owner of the following described property located in Section Township South Range East Assumption Parish Louisi ana Commencing at a corner common to the Northwest corner of Robin Street an d the Northeast corner of property now or formerly owned by Clifton Naquin proceed N E a distance along the Western right of way line of Robin Street a distance of thence along the same course a distance of to a point thence N W a distance of thenc e along the rear property line a distance of to a point thence alo ng the South property line a distance or to the point of beginning containing acres more or less as further depicted on the Survey Pla t showing a Acre Tract of Land Belonging to Louisiana Resources Co dated February prepared by Harold J Terracina RE a copy of w hich is attached as Exhibit A and incorporated herein for all purposes together with all improvements located thereon and all appurtenances theret o which property is hereinafter referred to as the Subject Property Th e improvements located on the Subject Property bear Municipal Address R obin Street Napoleonville Louisiana Whereas Seller is desirous of selling and Buyer is desirous of purchasing one hundred percent of Sellers interest in the Subject Property Now Therefore in consideration of the purchase price to be paid by Buye r to Seller and the mutual agreements contained herein the Parties hereto acknowledge and agree as follows Description of Property Seller agrees to sell and Buyer agrees to purchase all of Sellers right title and interest in the Subject Property The actual sale of the Subject Property shall be by Cash Sale containing special warranties substantially in the form of Exhibit B attached her eto and incorporated herein for all purposes Purchase Price The purchase price for the Subject Property to be paid by Buyer to Seller for the Subject Property shall be One Hundred Thous and Dollars in cash due and payable by cashiers check made p ayable to Seller and delivered to Seller contemporaneously with the receipt by Buyer of the Cash Sale executed by Seller and vesting all of Sellers o wnership interest in and to the Subject Property in Buyer Not an Option This is not an option but it is an executory contr act to buy and sell and it shall be so construed in all respects No Party may withdraw from this Agreement all Parties grant unto each other and res erve unto themselves the absolute right to demand specific performance of t his Agreement Warranties by Seller Sellers interest in and to the Subject Prop erty is and will be transferred to and accepted by Buyer AS IS WHERE IS AND IN ITS PRESENT CONDITION AND STATE OF REPAIR BUYER ACKNOWLEDGES THAT SELLER HAS NOT MADE AND SELLER HEREBY EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMS AND NEGATES ANY REPRESENTATION OR WARRANTY EXPRESS STATUTORY OR IMPLIED RELATING TO THE CONDITION OR QUALITY OF THE SUBJECT PROPERTY INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATIO N ANY AND ALL IMPLIED WARRANTIES UNDER APPLICABLE LAW NOW OR HEREAFTER IN EFFECT AND ANY IMPLIED OR EXPRESS WARRANTY REGARDING ENVIRONMENTAL LAWS B UYER HAS INSPECTED THE SUBJECT PROPERTY AND HAS SATISFIED ITSELF AS TO THE PHYSICAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITION BOTH SURFACE AND SUBSURFACE INCLUDIN G BUT NOT LIMITED TO CONDITIONS SPECIFICALLY RELATED TO THE PRESENCE RELEA SE OR DISPOSAL OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES BUYER EXPRESSLY WAIVES ALL CLAIMS TO ANY AND ALL REDHIBITORY DEFECTS ANDOR VICES AND ALL CLAIMS BASED ON THE FITNESS OF THE SUBJECT PROPERTY FOR ANY INTENDED PURPOSE BUYER IS RELYI NG SOLELY UPON ITS OWN INSPECTION OF THE SUBJECT PROPERTY AND BUYER SHALL A CCEPT ALL OF THE SAME IN AN AS IS WHERE IS CONDITION THERE ARE NO WARR ANTIES THAT EXTEND BEYOND THE FACE OF THIS PURCHASE AND SALE AGREEMENT AS T O THE SUBJECT PROPERTY Seller warrants that it is the record title owner of the Subject Propert y and warrants that it has good and merchantable title free and clear of any and all liens or encumbrances and agrees to indemnify and hold harmles s Buyer from and against all claims asserted by parties asserting adverse t itle liens or encumbrances Seller warrants that it is a corporation in good standing under the laws of the State of and that the person executing this Agreemen t and the Act of Cash Sale pursuant hereto on behalf of the Seller has vali d and binding authority to do so INDEMNITIES BUYER SHALL INDEMNIFY DEFEND REIMBURSE AND HOLD SELLER ITS PARENT AND AFFILIATES AND SUBSIDIARIES THE SELLER GROUP FR EE AND HARMLESS FROM ANY COSTS CLAIMS DAMAGES WHETHER ON ACCOUNT OF PERS ONAL INJURY OR DEATH OR ON ACCOUNT OR PROPERTY DAMAGE OR CAUSES OF ACTION AND LOSSES OF WHATSOEVER NATURE INCLUDING ATTORNEYS FEES AND COURT COSTS ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH OR IN ANY WAY ATTRIBUTABLE TO THE OW NERSHIP OF THE SUBJECT PROPERTY ON OR AFTER THE CLOSING DATE EXCEPT TO TH E EXTENT SUCH COSTS CLAIMS DAMAGES CAUSES OF ACTION OR LOSSES ARE DUE TO SELLERS GROSS NEGLIGENCE OR WILLFUL MISCONDUCT Proration of Taxes All property ad valorem and similar taxe s applicable to the Subject Property shall be prorated as of the Effective Date between Seller and Buyer Such proration shall be final and shall not be the subject of adjustment after the final bills are rendered Buyer sha ll be responsible for all taxes except income taxes of Seller and prepare all tax filings in respect to the Subject Property that are required to b e paid or filed after the Effective Date To the extent that any such taxe s filed and paid by Buyer are prorated hereunder Seller shall promptly pay upon of receipt of an invoice therefor from Buyer its pro rata share of same All taxes except Sellers income taxes occasioned by reason of thi s sale whether real personal or mixed shall be borne and paid solely by Buyer If for the current ad valorem tax year the taxable value of the S ubject Property that is the subject of this Agreement is determined by a sp ecial appraisal method that allows for appraisal of the property at less th an market value the person to whom the property is transferred may not be allowed to qualify the Subject Property for that special appraisal in a sub sequent tax year and the Subject Property may then be appraised at its full market value In addition the transfer of the Subject Property or a subs equent change in the use of the property may result in the imposition of an additional tax plus interest as a penalty for the transfer of the change i n the use of the land Buyer acknowledges that there shall be no proration for and Buyer shall be responsible for payment of any roll back taxes o r any other redetermination of property taxes assessed or relating to the y ear of the closing and years preceding the year of closing due or based upo n any change in the use of the Subject Property at and after the closing he reunder Disputes Any dispute relating to this Agreement shall be resolve d by binding selfadministered arbitration pursuant to the Commercial Arbi tration Rules of the American Arbitration Association AAA and all such proceedings shall be subject to the Federal Arbitration Act A single arbi trator shall be selected under the expedited rules of the AAA Only damage s allowed pursuant to this Agreement may be awarded and the arbitrator shal l have no authority to award consequential treble exemplary or punitive d amages of any type under any circumstances regardless of whether such damag es may be available under Louisiana law The arbitrator shall have the powe r to award the remedy of specific performance The results of such arbitrat ion shall be conclusive and binding provided however that both Parties s hall have the right to apply to a court of competent jurisdiction for such equitable relief as is necessary to preserve and enforce their rights under this Agreement Notwithstanding any of the foregoing provisions either P arty may join the other Party to any action suit or proceeding with respec t to which the Party seeking such joinder is a defendant if the other Part y is required to defend indemnify and hold harmless such defendant in acc ordance with the terms of the provisions hereof Judgment upon the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court having a jurisdictio n hereof Entirety and Severability This Agreement constitutes the entire a greement of the Parties related to the purchase and sale of the Subject Pro perty There are no prior or contemporaneous agreements or representations whether oral or written affecting the Subject Property other than those herein expressed In case any one or more of the provisions contained in t his Agreement shall for any reason be held to be invalid illegal or unenfo rceable in any respect such invalidity illegality or unenforceability sha ll not affect any other provision hereof and this Agreement shall be const rued as if such invalid illegal or unenforceable provisions had never been herein contained Governing Law THIS AGREEMENT SHALL BE CONSTRUED UNDER AND IN ACCO RDANCE WITH THE LAWS OF THE STATE OF LOUISIANA AND FEDERAL LAW AS SET FORTH IN PARAGRAPH ABOVE Successors and Assigns This Agreement and all of the terms and provisions hereof shall be binding upon and shall inure to the benefit of the Parties hereto and their respective successors and assigns Counterparts This Agreement may be executed in any number of counte rparts each of which shall be deemed to be an original and need not be sig ned by more than one of the Parties and all of which shall constitute one a nd the same agreement Further Assurances Each Party agrees that it will promptly perfo rm all other acts and execute and deliver all other documents as may be nec essary or appropriate to carry out the intent and purposes of this Agreemen t Attorneys Fees In the event of the commencement of an arbitrati on proceeding or a breach of any of the provisions contained herein by eith er Party the prevailing Party shall be entitled to collect from the other Party as part of its damages for said breach reasonable attorneys fees a ssociated with enforcing or defending any provision hereof Amendments This Agreement may be modified or amended only in writ ing signed by both Parties which expressly refers to this Agreement and sta tes an intention to modify or amend it No such amendment or modification shall be effected by use of any purchase order acknowledgment invoice or other form of either Party and in the event of conflict between the terms o f this Agreement and any such form the terms of this Agreement shall contr ol Waiver A waiver by either Party of a breach of any of the terms of this Agreement by the other Party shall not be deemed a waiver of any su bsequent breach of the terms of this Agreement The failure of any Party t o insist upon strict performance of any provisions of this Agreement or to exercise any right under it shall not constitute a waiver of that provision Termination This Agreement shall expire and shall be of no furth er force or effect Ninety days from the Effective Date unless prior to such time the Parties have entered into an act of Cash Sale transferring t he Subject Property from the Seller to the Buyer Each
